title: Poster, AIGA Program Announcment: Meteors and Metaphors, 1990–91
title_raw: AIGA Program Announcment: Meteors and Metaphors
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
signed: Verso, imprinted lower right: Design: Gretchen Frederick, Andres E. Tremois, Invisions, Ltd. / Photography: William H. Dempsey III; Karen Holtzberg / Copy Wiring: Leo Mullen, Invisions, Ltd / Printing: Peake Printing, Inc. / Typesetting: Composition Systems, Inc. , Trade Typeographers Inc. / Paper/Envelopes: Frank Parsons Paper Company, Inc.
inscribed:
Recto, imprinted in yellow radiating lines, upper left:  An / AIGA / Washington DC / program series / designed / to broaden / the context and / enlarge / the perspective / within which / innovation / can occur. / Turning our attention / outward / to discover / the familiar world / in new and / unfamiliar ways.
In yellow lower right: AIGA Washington DC 1990-91 Fall/Winter Programs
Imprinted on verso:Schedule of events for the Fall/Winter series [see Notes field]
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman.
description:
Recto: Poster for the Fall/Winter season of the Washington AIGA.  Design is dominated by three orbs: a circular ball, a close up image of the pupil of the eye, and the earth seen from a distance [an exercise in scale]. The photographic image is reproduced in cool grays, purple and green creating a sense of mystery.  Along the left edge in white letters reading from upper left to lower left, METEORS AND METAPHORS / ENLARGING THE DESIGN PERSPECTIVE. At upper left are yellow radiating letters.
Verso: Reading horizontaly left from right, the scheduled events, programs and lectures are presented in black type against a white ground.  A yellow sunburst at upper left scatters long yellow rays across the sheet. A schedule of events season pass and reservation form printed across lower edge of sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, AIGA Program Announcment: Meteors and Metaphors, 1990–91. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-208.
